forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy, with a low around 44. South southeast wind around 13 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy, with a high near 56. South southwest wind 12 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 24 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the night deepens over Downtown San Francisco, rain falls steadily, draping the city in a shroud of clouds and creating an atmosphere that feels both intimate and introspective. The temperature tumbles to a brisk 44 degrees, and a south-southeast wind whispers through the streets, carrying with it the unmistakable scent of the ocean, mingled with the damp earth. The forecast heralds a continuation of this drenching on Friday, promising a high of 56 degrees while maintaining a relentless rainfall that could reach a quarter of an inch. Visibility is limited, with fog draping the Golden Gate Bridge in an ethereal veil, blurring the lines of reality and imagination. You may find pockets of the marine layer clinging closely to the coast, wrapping the city in a cozy dampness.

Dressing for this weather calls for layers; a warm waterproof jacket paired with sturdy boots will offer both comfort and utility against the elements. Consider indulging in a warm beverage while wandering the cozy cafés dotting the streets, or perhaps lose yourself in the winding aisles of a local bookstore, nestled away from the rain. These mundane moments—navigating the soft glow of streetlamps reflected in puddles or watching the world slip by through a rain-streaked window—can transform a typical day into a quiet reflection of life’s simple pleasures.
